pull.title: Make release-process.md more generic
pull.body: I noticed that release-process.md refers in most places specifically to version 0.8.0, and in one place specifically to 0.5.1. This pull request fixes that.

events.body:
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/c468c1c44b50f9a105bdf4d407a5dbf7e09bd8a7 for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.

The reason for being overly specific is to show the _exact_ format in which the version has to be given. I have been known for adding v's in front where there should not be, for example. If you do this, specify exactly what format is expected.
Well you are right, perhaps @Michagogo add a line describing what (new version) needs to be via an example or such.

@Laanwj Ah, I see what you're saying. When I get back to my computer I'll take a look and see if I can think of a way to demonstrate... The fact that it can be more than just numbers (i.e. 0.8.2rc3, not just 0.8.2) is important to clarify, IMHO. Also, I agree with you that it can be confusing regarding where you should and shouldn't prepend a `v' -- I'm not sure why it belongs in some places and not others. If you have any suggestions in the meantime regarding how to phrase it, I'd be glad to hear them.
â€”
Sent from Mailbox for iPhone

On Sun, May 26, 2013 at 2:39 PM, Wladimir J. van der Laan
notifications@github.com wrote:

> ## The reason for being overly specific is to show the _exact_ format in which the version has to be given. I have been known for adding v's in front where there should not be, for example. If you do this, specify exactly what format is expected.
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
> https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/2697#issuecomment-18461755
For me the current phrasing is fine, as it says "for example" and 0.8.0 is just an example. You could make it 0.8.0rc3 to show that the rc, if relevant, also needs to be added.

@laanwj The current phrasing doesn't say "for example", it provides values. IMHO, it should be like with the "export SIGNER=" line, making it clear that this is somewhere to fill in your own file. I've tweaked it a bit. What do you think?

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/3b807eb90e357524ccc94c333afbdbc1553ef697 for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.
@Michagogo Can you squash this into a single commit?
@fanquake I apologize for my ignorance, but how exactly do I do that?

events.message:
Made more generic by removing specific version references

Tweaked a little bit to provide examples.

Squashed commits into 1, while hoping not to break anything

events.body: @fanquake Okay, I _think_ I just did that...
